title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to Joseph Milsted, June 4, 1867
summary: Jackson's letter to Joseph Milsted relates an accusation against Milsted's wife, who beat the child of Peyton Harris, a man whom Milsted employs. Jackson also states that Milsted has no right to beat anyone, and that he must supply reasonable cause in order to breach a contract.
keywords: Employment/Labor, Violence/Crime, Women, American Civil War
